prior_works.title: Neural Ordinary Differential Equations
prior_works.authors: Ricky T. Q. Chen, Yulia Rubanova, Jesse Bettencourt, David Duvenaud
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Introduced parameterizing data evolution via continuous-time velocity fields, directly inspiring Rectified Point Flow’s core idea of learning a point-wise velocity field that transports points toward target positions.

prior_works.title: FFJORD: Free-form Continuous Dynamics for Scalable Reversible Generative Models
prior_works.authors: Will Grathwohl, Ricky T. Q. Chen, Jesse Bettencourt, Ilya Sutskever, David Duvenaud
prior_works.role: Continuous normalizing flows for generative transport
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrated practical training of continuous normalizing flows, providing the generative-transport viewpoint that Rectified Point Flow adapts to conditionally move source point clouds to target configurations.

prior_works.title: Score-Based Generative Modeling through Stochastic Differential Equations
prior_works.authors: Yang Song, Jascha Sohl-Dickstein, Diederik P. Kingma, Abhishek Kumar, Stefano Ermon, Ben Poole
prior_works.role: Probability flow ODE view of generation
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Established the probability flow ODE perspective that connects diffusion/score models to deterministic velocity fields, underpinning RPF’s training of a conditional velocity field that straightens transport from noise/unposed inputs to posed targets.

prior_works.title: FlowNet3D: Learning Scene Flow in 3D Point Clouds
prior_works.authors: Xingyi Liu, Charles R. Qi, Leonidas J. Guibas
prior_works.role: Point-wise motion fields on point clouds
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Showed that learning per-point motion vectors on raw point sets is effective, motivating RPF’s point-wise velocity parameterization for transporting unposed points to their target locations.

prior_works.title: Deep Closest Point: Learning Representations for Point Cloud Registration
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Framed point cloud registration as learning correspondences/poses, a task RPF subsumes by replacing pose regression with a conditional transport field that implicitly yields the relative transform.

prior_works.title: RPM-Net: Robust Point Matching using Learned Features
prior_works.authors: Tze Sian Yew, Gim Hee Lee
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Emphasized robust feature learning and soft matching for registration; RPF leverages this insight by focusing its encoder on contact/overlap cues but recovers poses via generative transport rather than explicit correspondence optimization.

prior_works.title: Normalized Object Coordinate Space (NOCS) for Category-Level 6D Object Pose and Size Estimation
prior_works.authors: He Wang, Srinath Sridhar, Jingwei Huang, Julien Valentin, Shuran Song, Leonidas J. Guibas
prior_works.role: Canonical mapping and symmetry handling for pose
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Showed that mapping observations to a canonical coordinate space enables pose recovery and highlighted symmetry issues; RPF generalizes this idea by learning a continuous transport to target positions that intrinsically resolves symmetries without labels.

synthesis_narrative:
Rectified Point Flow (RPF) fuses two trajectories of prior work: continuous-time generative transport and learning-based 3D registration/assembly. On the generative side, Neural ODEs established representing dynamics with learned velocity fields, and FFJORD showed how to train such flows as practical generative models. Score-based SDEs then connected diffusion to deterministic probability flow ODEs, crystallizing the principle of learning a velocity field that transports simple noise to data. RPF adapts this transport paradigm to a conditional setting on point clouds, learning a point-wise velocity field that moves unposed points to their target positions, from which rigid part poses can be recovered.
On the geometric side, FlowNet3D validated learning per-point motion vectors directly on unordered point sets, foreshadowing RPF’s point-wise velocity parameterization. Deep Closest Point and RPM-Net reframed registration as learned feature matching and robust pose estimation, revealing the importance of overlap/contact cues; RPF retains this insight via an overlap-aware encoder but sidesteps brittle correspondence/pose regression by using generative transport to implicitly align parts. Finally, NOCS demonstrated that mapping observations to a canonical target enables pose recovery while exposing symmetry ambiguities. RPF generalizes this idea: its learned transport intrinsically captures symmetric assemblies without explicit symmetry labels. Together, these works enabled RPF’s unified conditional generative formulation that spans pairwise registration and multi-part assembly and benefits from joint training across heterogeneous datasets.
